body: For some more numbers, this almost doubled the installation size of ESLint: https://packagephobia.com/result?p=eslint

I was bumping deps and saw the lockfile diff was enormous. Sure enough, going back to ~9.25.0...
```
> npm i eslint@~9.25.0
added 1 package, removed 70 packages, changed 1 package
```

I support having this in a separate package.

body:
Thanks for the feedback everyone. We can definitely take a look at how to reduce the download size. 

The reason we didn't start with a separate package is because we weren't quite sure what parts of the `eslint` package we'd need to make the MCP server work. Keeping it all together meant we could iterate quickly and not have to worry about updating external-facing APIs as needed.

With what we know so far, it seems like spinning off into a separate package is possible and makes sense. We won't be rolling back this most recent release as we do need to get feedback on actually using the MCP server to be sure any plans going forward make sense.

Apologies if I'm missing something, but could you achieve both the "iterate quickly and get feedback" goal and the "reduce download size / dependency surface" goal by adopting [@jfrs 's suggestion](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/19682#issuecomment-2849254461) of changing `@modelcontextprotocol/sdk` and `zod` to optional peer dependencies? Then the new `--mcp` option could still live in the eslint CLI (at least during this phase of development) but could display a nice error and exit if its dependencies are missing.
